definitions: destroy something completely so that nothing remains of it
examples: The powerful explosion annihilated the abandoned building entirely
Nuclear weapons could annihilate entire cities within seconds

definitions: cause someone to feel slightly angry or impatient by irritating them
disturb or bother someone repeatedly with unwanted actions or sounds
examples: His constant tapping on the desk really annoys me
Please don't annoy your sister while she's studying
Mosquitoes annoy campers with their persistent buzzing and biting
The neighbor's loud music continues to annoy everyone nearby

definitions: declare something legally invalid or void so it no longer exists
examples: The court decided to annul their marriage after discovering fraud
The government moved to annul the controversial law immediately

definitions: cause someone to become hostile or angry by opposing or provoking them deliberately
examples: His rude comments only served to antagonize his coworkers further
Try not to antagonize the bear by making sudden movements

definitions: put up money as a stake or payment before receiving cards in poker or similar games
examples: Each player must ante five dollars before receiving their cards
If you want to play, you'll need to ante up first

definitions: perform playful, silly, or amusing tricks or pranks to entertain others
examples: The clown would antic around the circus ring making children laugh
The puppies antic in the yard chasing butterflies all afternoon

definitions: give something an aged appearance through special treatment or finishing techniques
search for and collect old valuable objects from shops or markets
examples: She learned to antique furniture using special paints and techniques
The craftsman can antique new wood to match historical pieces
They love to antique at flea markets every weekend morning
We spent our vacation antiquing through small towns in Vermont

definitions: copy or imitate someone's behavior, movements, or mannerisms in an obvious way
examples: Children often ape their parents' gestures without realizing it
The comedian would ape famous politicians during his performance routine

definitions: express regret or say sorry for something wrong you have done or said
examples: She decided to apologise for arriving late to the meeting
He should apologise to his friend for the misunderstanding yesterday

definitions: dress someone in clothing, especially formal or special garments for occasions
examples: The bride was beautifully appareled in white silk and lace
Knights would apparel themselves in armor before going into battle

definitions: make someone less angry or upset by giving them what they want or need
examples: The manager tried to appease angry customers with discount coupons
Offering food might appease the crying child for a while

definitions: add something to the end of a document, list, or piece of writing
examples: Please append your signature to the bottom of this contract
The programmer will append new data to the existing database file

definitions: show approval or enjoyment by clapping hands together repeatedly after a performance
express strong approval or praise for someone's actions or achievements publicly
examples: The audience began to applaud enthusiastically after the amazing performance
Everyone stood up to applaud the talented young pianist
Critics applaud the director's bold vision for the new film
We should applaud her efforts to help the local community

definitions: catch and arrest someone who is suspected of committing a crime
understand or grasp the meaning of something difficult or complex mentally
examples: Police officers managed to apprehend the suspect after a chase
Security guards will apprehend anyone trying to enter without permission
It took time to apprehend the full implications of the decision
Students struggle to apprehend complex mathematical concepts at first

definitions: work for an expert to learn a trade or skill through practical experience
examples: She decided to apprentice with a master carpenter for two years
Young blacksmiths would apprentice for years before opening their shops

definitions: come close to something in quality, nature, or quantity without being exact
examples: The replica can only approximate the beauty of the original painting
Scientists try to approximate natural conditions in laboratory experiments

definitions: act as a neutral third party to help settle a disagreement between others
examples: The judge will arbitrate between the two companies in their dispute
A professional mediator was hired to arbitrate the labor negotiations

definitions: move through the air in a curved path like part of a circle
examples: The ball will arc high over the fence into the field
Lightning can arc between clouds during a powerful thunderstorm

definitions: form or bend into a curved shape like the top of a doorway
examples: The cat will arch its back when it feels threatened
She learned to arch her eyebrows to express surprise effectively

definitions: cover or protect something with a hard protective layer or defensive material
examples: They decided to armor the vehicle with bulletproof steel plates
Medieval knights would armor themselves before going into fierce battles

definitions: cause a feeling, emotion, or response to begin in someone
wake someone up from sleep or make them become active and alert
examples: The speech managed to arouse strong emotions in the audience
Mysterious sounds at night can arouse fear in young children
Loud noises will arouse the baby from her afternoon nap
The smell of coffee brewing will arouse him every morning

definitions: express thoughts, ideas, or feelings clearly in words so others understand
connect bones or parts together with joints that allow movement
examples: She can articulate complex ideas in simple terms everyone understands
The professor struggles to articulate his theories to first-year students
The robot's arms articulate at multiple points for precise movement
These bones articulate with each other to form the knee joint

definitions: go up or climb to a higher position or level gradually
examples: The hikers slowly ascend the steep mountain trail every summer
Hot air balloons ascend gracefully into the clear morning sky

definitions: find out something for certain by making careful inquiry or investigation
examples: Detectives work to ascertain the facts before making any arrests
The doctor will ascertain the cause of your symptoms through tests

definitions: say or believe that something is caused by or belongs to someone or something
examples: Historians ascribe the victory to the general's brilliant strategy
People often ascribe human emotions to their pets' behavior

definitions: cover a road or surface with a black sticky substance made from petroleum
examples: The city will asphalt all the damaged roads this summer
Workers began to asphalt the parking lot early Monday morning

definitions: have a strong desire or ambition to achieve something important in life
examples: Many young athletes aspire to compete in the Olympic Games
She continues to aspire to become a successful business owner

definitions: murder an important person, especially a political leader, for political or religious reasons
examples: The plot to assassinate the president was discovered by security forces
Throughout history, people have tried to assassinate powerful leaders

definitions: test or analyze a substance, especially metal or ore, to determine its ingredients
examples: The laboratory will assay the gold ore for purity levels
Chemists assay mineral samples to determine their commercial value

definitions: express agreement or approval, especially in a formal or official way
examples: The board members must assent to the proposed changes unanimously
She nodded to assent to his request for additional time

definitions: take in and fully understand information, ideas, or nutrients into a system
become similar to the surrounding culture or environment by adopting its characteristics
examples: Students need time to assimilate new concepts before taking exams
The body must assimilate nutrients from food for proper growth
Immigrants often assimilate into their new country's culture over time
New employees quickly assimilate the company's working style and values

definitions: make an unpleasant feeling or pain less intense or severe through comfort
examples: The mother tried to assuage her child's fears about the dark
Nothing could assuage his guilt about the terrible accident

definitions: mark something with a star-shaped symbol to indicate special attention or footnote
examples: Please asterisk the most important items on your shopping list
The editor will asterisk words that need further explanation below

definitions: make amends or reparation for a wrong or injury one has done
examples: He tried to atone for his mistakes by working extra hours
She hopes to atone for her harsh words with a sincere apology

definitions: gradually decline in effectiveness or vigor due to underuse or neglect
examples: Muscles will atrophy if you don't exercise them regularly
His social skills began to atrophy after years of isolation

definitions: succeed in achieving something that one has worked for over time
examples: She worked hard to attain her dream of becoming a doctor
Few climbers attain the summit of Mount Everest each year

definitions: provide evidence or proof that something is true or genuine
examples: Several witnesses can attest to his presence at the meeting
These documents attest the authenticity of the ancient manuscript

definitions: dress someone in clothes of a particular type, especially formal clothing
examples: The actors attire themselves in period costumes for the play
Guests should attire themselves appropriately for the formal dinner

definitions: sell goods or property to the highest bidder at a public sale event
examples: The estate will auction the antique furniture collection next month
They decided to auction their rare stamp collection for charity

definitions: conduct an auction by accepting bids and declaring goods sold to highest bidders
examples: He learned to auctioneer at his family's auction house business
She will auctioneer the charity event to raise money for schools

definitions: officially examine and verify financial accounts and records for accuracy
attend a course or class without receiving academic credit for it
examples: The company hires accountants to audit their books every year
Government agencies audit businesses to ensure tax compliance
She decided to audit the philosophy class out of personal interest
Many professionals audit university courses to update their knowledge

definitions: perform a short piece to show skills when trying to get a role
examples: Hundreds of actors audition for each role in major films
She plans to audition for the lead role in the school play

definitions: make something greater by adding to it in size, number, or intensity
examples: The company will augment its workforce during the busy season
Musicians often augment their income by teaching private lessons

definitions: predict or indicate what will happen in the future from signs or omens
examples: Dark clouds augur an approaching storm within the next hour
These early sales figures augur well for the product's success

definitions: prove that something is real, true, or genuine through examination or evidence
examples: Experts will authenticate the painting before the museum purchases it
The bank must authenticate your identity before opening an account

definitions: give official permission or approval for something to happen or be done
examples: The manager must authorise all purchases over five hundred dollars
Parents need to authorise their children's field trip participation

definitions: write one's signature on something, especially for an admirer or collector
examples: The famous author will autograph books after her reading tonight
Fans waited hours for the player to autograph their jerseys

definitions: convert a process or facility to be operated by machines or computers instead of people
examples: The factory plans to automate production to increase efficiency
Many companies automate repetitive tasks to save time and money

definitions: help or benefit someone in achieving something they want or need
examples: All their efforts to save the business did not avail
His connections might avail us in getting the necessary permits

definitions: come down rapidly and overwhelmingly like snow sliding down a mountain
examples: Complaints began to avalanche into the customer service department
Orders avalanche in whenever they announce a major sale
